titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Abraham Anson papers, 1939-2005
titlestmt.subtitle: Abraham Anson C0069
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Bill Keeler

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Abraham Anson papers

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: George Mason University. Libraries. Special Collections Research Center.

did.abstract: The collection includes aerial photographs, publications, newspapers, magazines, correspondence, notebooks, color slides, glass slides, and maps.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: There are no restrictions on personal use. Permission to publish material from the Abaraham Anson papers must be obtained from Special Collections Research Center, George Mason University Libraries.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Abraham Anson papers, C0069, Special Collections and Archives, George Mason University Libraries.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Collection donated by Myra Anson-Nicholas on December 5, 2005.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Bill Keeler in January 2018. EAD markup completed by Bill Keeler in January 2018.

bioghist.head: Biographical Information
bioghist.p: Born January 21, 1912 to Ida and Emil Anson, Abraham Anson attended New York City University before joining the army. During his service, Anson would attain the rank of Lieutenant Colonel as well as make significant contributions to the training of incoming recruits. He retired from the army on January 21, 1972. Anson was paramount in the designing of equipment with the Army Corps of Engineers that aided in mapping.

Anson was an incredibly active member with the American Society for Photogrammetry and Remote Sensing and also has a memorial scholarship in his name. Along with his significant contributions to the world of photogrammetry, the process of measuring distances between objects through the utilization of photography, Anson was extremely adept at surveying and mapping, and was a very talented painter. Abraham Anson passed away May 29, 2005.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The collection includes numerous aerial photographs, publications, photography equipment, newspapers, magazines, correspondence, notebooks, color slides, and maps. The collection is arranged into three series.:
Series 1: Personal Items (1939-2005) includes notes, correspondence, academic records, memoirs, programs, and military records.
Series 2: Maps and Photographs (1940-2004) includes maps, color slides, glass slides, and photographs.
Series 3: Publications (1943-2005) includes books, magazines, reports, and manuscripts.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged into three series.

did.unittitle: Series 1: Personal Items,

scopecontent.p: This series includes notes, correspondence, academic records, and military records.
